TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SqlBulkCopyOptions extends System.Enum

summary.span: Bitwise flag that specifies one or more options to use with an instance of .

span.span: Bitwise flag that specifies one or more options to use with an instance of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Vous pouvez utiliser la énumération lorsque vous construisez un instance pour modifier la se comportent des méthodes pour cette instance.You can use the enumeration when you construct a instance to change how the methods for that instance behave. ## Examples L’application console suivante montre comment effectuer un chargement en bloc qui copie la valeur dans la colonne d’identité de la table source vers la colonne correspondante dans la table de destination, au lieu de générer une nouvelle valeur pour la colonne d’identité de chaque ligne.The following console application demonstrates how to perform a bulk load that copies the value in the identity column of the source table to the corresponding column in the destination table, instead of generating a new value for each row's identity column. Pour voir comment l’option change le fonctionnement du chargement en bloc, exécutez l’exemple avec la **dbo. BulkCopyDemoMatchingColumns** table vide.To see how the option changes the way the bulk load works, run the sample with the **dbo.BulkCopyDemoMatchingColumns** table empty. Chargement de toutes les lignes de la source.All rows load from the source. Ensuite, exécutez à nouveau l’exemple sans vider la table.Next, run the sample again without emptying the table. Une exception est levée et le code écrit un message dans la fenêtre de console qui vous informe que lignes n’ont pas été ajoutés en raison de violations de clé primaire.An exception is thrown, and the code writes a message to the console window notifying you that rows were not added because of primary key violations. > [!IMPORTANT] > Cet exemple ne s’exécutera pas, sauf si vous avez créé les tables de travail comme décrit dans [exemple de configuration de copie en bloc](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/bulk-copy-example-setup.md).This sample will not run unless you have created the work tables as described in [Bulk Copy Example Setup](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql/bulk-copy-example-setup.md). Ce code est fourni pour illustrer la syntaxe pour l’utilisation de **SqlBulkCopy** uniquement.This code is provided to demonstrate the syntax for using **SqlBulkCopy** only. Si les tables source et de destination sont dans la même instance de SQL Server, il est plus facile et plus rapide d’utiliser Transact-SQL `INSERT … SELECT` instruction pour copier les données.If the source and destination tables are in the same SQL Server instance, it is easier and faster to use a Transact-SQL `INSERT … SELECT` statement to copy the data. [!code-csharp[DataWorks SqlBulkCopy.KeepIdentity#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks SqlBulkCopy.KeepIdentity/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DataWorks SqlBulkCopy.KeepIdentity#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/DataWorks SqlBulkCopy.KeepIdentity/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions AllowEncryptedValueModifications = int32(64)

summary.span: When specified, **AllowEncryptedValueModifications** enables bulk copying of encrypted data between tables or databases, without decrypting the data.

span.span: When specified, **AllowEncryptedValueModifications** enables bulk copying of encrypted data between tables or databases, without decrypting the data.

summary.span: Typically, an application would select data from encrypted columns from one table without decrypting the data (the app would connect to the database with the column encryption setting keyword set to disabled) and then would use this option to bulk insert the data, which is still encrypted.

span.span: Typically, an application would select data from encrypted columns from one table without decrypting the data (the app would connect to the database with the column encryption setting keyword set to disabled) and then would use this option to bulk insert the data, which is still encrypted.

summary.span: Use caution when specifying **AllowEncryptedValueModifications** as this may lead to corrupting the database because the driver does not check if the data is indeed encrypted, or if it is correctly encrypted using the same encryption type, algorithm and key as the target column.

span.span: Use caution when specifying **AllowEncryptedValueModifications** as this may lead to corrupting the database because the driver does not check if the data is indeed encrypted, or if it is correctly encrypted using the same encryption type, algorithm and key as the target column.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions CheckConstraints = int32(2)

summary.span: Check constraints while data is being inserted.

span.span: Check constraints while data is being inserted.

summary.span: By default, constraints are not checked.

span.span: By default, constraints are not checked.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions Default = int32(0)

summary.span: Use the default values for all options.

span.span: Use the default values for all options.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions FireTriggers = int32(16)

summary.span: When specified, cause the server to fire the insert triggers for the rows being inserted into the database.

span.span: When specified, cause the server to fire the insert triggers for the rows being inserted into the database.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions KeepIdentity = int32(1)

summary.span: When not specified, identity values are assigned by the destination.

span.span: When not specified, identity values are assigned by the destination.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions KeepNulls = int32(8)

summary.span: Preserve null values in the destination table regardless of the settings for default values.

span.span: Preserve null values in the destination table regardless of the settings for default values.

summary.span: When not specified, null values are replaced by default values where applicable.

span.span: When not specified, null values are replaced by default values where applicable.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions TableLock = int32(4)

summary.span: Obtain a bulk update lock for the duration of the bulk copy operation.

span.span: Obtain a bulk update lock for the duration of the bulk copy operation.

summary.span: When not specified, row locks are used.

span.span: When not specified, row locks are used.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopyOptions UseInternalTransaction = int32(32)

summary.span: When specified, each batch of the bulk-copy operation will occur within a transaction.

span.span: When specified, each batch of the bulk-copy operation will occur within a transaction.

summary.span: If you indicate this option and also provide a object to the constructor, an occurs.

span.span: If you indicate this option and also provide a object to the constructor, an occurs.
